content.description:
Old Man's Crack lies on the left hand side of the boulder and is also visible from the road.

Follow the obvious,overhanging, juggy crack up to its end and pull the cruxy topout by throwing a heel... Or your whole leg over the top of the boulder.

Sit start.
content.protection: Bring a spotter or risk a fall that leads to a tumble down the steep revine behind you.

content.description:
Gemini is awesome!

At first glance, this arete climb looks pretty average, but the exposure, cool holds, and cruxy topout make up for its appearance!

Sit start on the bottom right side of the boulder on a cool, slopey jug. Cross right hand or gaston to the small, slopey crip, then follow the bumpy slopers up the arete until reaching the sidepull and the horn at the highest tip of the boulder. Throw a heel over the arete and muscle your way through the cruxy topout.

I was gonna give it V5... But I figured it deserved better because of its topout.
content.protection: Once again, a spotter would be smart.
content.location: Climb the right arete of the Gemini boulder.
